Posts.Content: Mar 15, 2018 01:20PM 2catsintheyard wrote: Thank you to everyone for your info and support. I was diagnosed in October 2017 (very funny universe for it to be breast cancer awareness month...), have had neo adjutant 6 rounds TCHP and have a bilateral BMX with direct implant scheduled 4/11. I hope you don't mind if I post here in March. My question is, I have been told to schedule a 'very helpful' mastectomy class through Honor Health. The problem is, it is very inconvenient to me (and far away) to attend. Has anyone else been to a class like this? Is it worth the time and effort, or did you get all the info you needed at the surgery center? Are there any comparable tutorials online?
Posts.Title: March 2018 Surgery Group mkn86 Kaykat

Posts.Content: Jul 30, 2018 08:05AM 2catsintheyard wrote: Wendy-yes also to the nipple pain Annies - LOL ‘zappery grind’, I feel that. FYI-my ro told me not to use Vitamins C or E in any creams, drinks, supplements (any product other than foods you eat) due to possible additional adverse skin reactions. Off soon to start of boosts-FIVE to go
Posts.Title: JULY 2018 Radiation? jerseymom12 Marymc86

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2018 05:09PM 2catsintheyard wrote: Finished 28 zaps & 5 boosts to R breast on August 3, but am feeling more fatigued this week than any other. It feels like I am walking through water and hit the wall about 3-4:00 each day which is bad for me considering I work evenings! Has anyone else felt this way too? Foreverd-sorry you are suffering. I didn’t have it quite as bad as you skin-wise, but going topless at home some of the time sure helped!
